intro: Elacholoma, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Elacholoma typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
